refbody.section: PurposeLeave edit mode or an edit submode. If you are not in an edit session, you can use exit to log off from the current session.
Usage NotesConfiguration changes are saved when the edit session is ended, not on leaving an edit submode. This might cause validation errors to be displayed later than expected.

ExampleEnter an edit session for an ethernet-interface object and enter the ip submode. Add an IP address and then exit the ip submode and exit the edit session. edit ethernet-interface eth2 Console ethernet-interface:eth2> ip Entering "ip" mode Console ethernet-interface:eth2 ip> append address 192.0.2.0/24 Console ethernet-interface:eth2 ip> exit Console ethernet-interface:eth2> exit
Log off from the appliance.admin@(none)> exit
